hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Neutral Transition via Gamma Exposure Flip and Momentum Decay
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes where 24-hour taker flow gamma exposure flips from positive to negative while 5-day momentum (ROC) decays from >15% to <5%, a breakdown below the 10-day volume-weighted average price signals regime transition to NEUTRAL within 48 hours with 75% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Gamma exposure flips indicate options dealers shifting from amplifying rallies to suppressing volatility. Combined with momentum decay and breakdown below active trader reference price (VWAP), this suggests institutional profit-taking and reduced bullish conviction, often preceding neutral consolidation.
entry_conditions: 24h taker-flow gamma exposure flips from >$10M to <-$5M
BTC 5-day rate of change decays from >15% to <5% over 3 sessions
Price breaks below 10-day VWAP on >1.5x average volume
Perp funding rates drop from >0.01% to <0.002%
Top 10 altcoins underperform BTC by >5% over 48h

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to NEUTRAL OR 6% gain (short position)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such signals (2021-2024) see immediate bull regime resumption (>10% continuation) rather than neutral transition.
